Ammunition.Name: Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Ammunition used for crossbows. 
A widespread, common type of bolt.

Ammunition.Name: Magicbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. 
The tip is daubed with a glintstone tincture. Deals magic damage. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Serpent Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow carved to resemble a flying snake. Used in tandem with the Serpent Bow.   
 Loyal minions of the Formless Serpents, their fangs are daubed with deadly poison.

Ammunition.Name: Lightningbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt crafted from animal bone with a lightning-infused tip. Deals lightning damage. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Bloodbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. 
The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Stormwing Bone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones fletched with stormhawk feathers. 
Craftable item. 

Flies enshrouded in storm winds, breaking enemy stances and guards with ease.

Ammunition.Name: Rotbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with rot. Afflicts targets with scarlet rot. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Firebone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is set alight before firing. Deals fire damage. 
 Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Coldbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a frozen tip. 
Afflicts targets with frost. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Firebone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. 
The tip is set alight before firing. 
Deals fire damage to foes.

Ammunition.Name: Poisonbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. 
The tip is daubed with venom. 
Afflicts targets with poison. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Golem's Magic Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatarrow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. Imbued with its ancient magic. 
Deals magic damage.

Ammunition.Name: Firebone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. 
The tip is set alight before firing

Ammunition.Name: Perfumer's Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt created with perfumer techniques. Used by nobles' guards and the like. 
 The point of impact explodes with sparks, dealing fire damage.

Ammunition.Name: Haligbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Black-Key Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolts used in Crepus' Black-Key Crossbow, an assassin's tool of exquisite craftmanship. 
 The intricate spiral tip bores deep, injecting scarlet rot far into the flesh of its target.

Ammunition.Name: Haligbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage. 
Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunition.Name: Explosive Bolt
Ammunition.Lore: Bolt tipped with a shard of Explosive Stone. Explodes on impact, dealing fire damage.

Ammunition.Name: Shattershard Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore: Arrow whittled from animal bones tipped with a shard of crystal. Creates a resonating noise at the point of impact.

Ammunition.Name: Radahn's Spear
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatarrows used by the General Radahns during the festival of combat. These are in fact the many spears with which he was stabbed by the Cleanrot Knights. 

Imbued with Radahn's gravitational power.

Ammunition.Name: Bone Ballista Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatbolt as large as a spear carved from stout animal bones. Craftable item. 
 Though the tip is certainly sharp, it does not fly particularly true.

Ammunition.Name: Bone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from thin animal bones. 
Though the arrowhead is sharp indeed, it doesn't fly particularly true.

Ammunition.Name: Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrows used with small and long bows. 
Unremarkable in any way, shape or form.

Ammunition.Name: Bone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from a thin animal bone. Craftable item. 
 Though the tip is certainly sharp, it does not fly particularly true.

Ammunition.Name: Bone Great Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatarrow as large as a spear whittled from stout animal bones. 
Craftable item. 
The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunition.Name: Ballista Bolt
Ammunition.Lore: Greatbolt as large as a spear for use with Hand Ballista.

Ammunition.Name: Rainbow Stone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones tipped with chips of Rainbow Stone. Colored lights shine at the point of impact. 
 
 Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Burred Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt covered in thorns. One of the most horrific weapons used in the Shattering. Afflicts with blood loss. 
 Diffcult to remove once buried in flesh, causes appalling damage to the body

Ammunition.Name: Meteor Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Enchanted work of craft made in tandem with Full Moon Crossbow. The tip is embedded with glintstone. 
 Like a shooting star, these bolts leave a beautiful trail when fired.  Deals magic damage.

Ammunition.Name: Sleepbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. 
The tip is daubed with a water lily tincture. 
Afflicts targets with drowsiness. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Sleepbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a waterlily tincture. 
Afflicts targets with sleep.

Ammunition.Name: Lightningbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a lightning-infused tip. Deals lightning damage. 
 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Fire Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow with the tip set alight.  
Deals fire damage.

Ammunition.Name: Lightning Greatbolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatbolt tipped with a clump of Gravel Stone shards.   
 Deals powerful lightning damage.

Ammunition.Name: Haligbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled From animal bones. The tip is daubed with a golden tincture. Deals holy damage. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Golden Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt blessed with an incantation of the Erdtree. Deals powerful holy damage
 
 Once used by guards of the Capital.

Ammunition.Name: Poisonbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. 
The tip is daubed with venom. 
Afflicts targets with poison. 
Craftable item. 
The addition of fletching enables more precise shots that can travel farther.

Ammunition.Name: Bone Great Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatarrow as large as a spear whittled from stout animal bones. 
Though the tip is certainly sharp, it does not fly particularly true.

Ammunition.Name: Golden Great Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Carved greatarrows made together with the Erdtree Greatbow. Deals holy damage. 
 
 Imbued with an oath-sworn incantation, which boosts the attack and defense of the archer and their nearby allies.

Ammunition.Name: St. Trina's Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow carved to resemble a withered water lily. Afflicts targets
with a powerful sleep effect. 
 Priests of St. Trina use these arrows to spread their teachings. The sweet oblivion of sleep can become quite the habit.

Ammunition.Name: Bone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from thin animal bones. 
The feather fletchings add distance and accuracy to the standard bone arrow.

Ammunition.Name: Coldbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a frozen tip. 
Afflicts targets with frost. 
Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunition.Name: Magicbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a glintstone tincture. 
Deals magic damage. 
 
Craftable item. The Retching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunition.Name: Flaming Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt with a fiercely burned tip. Deals powerful fire damage. 
 Used by survivors of Radahn's army to stave off the scarlet rot.

Ammunition.Name: Rotbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with rot. Afflicts targets with scarlet rot. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Lightningbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones with a lightning-infused tip. Deals lightning damage. 
 
Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunition.Name: Great Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
A greatarrow as large as a spear for use with greatbows. 
Used by archers of monstrous strength employed by a lord's army.

Ammunition.Name: Dwelling Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow in which the spirits of small animals are thought to dwell. 
Deals magic damage.

Ammunition.Name: Sleepbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. 
The tip is daubed with a water lily tincture. 
Afflicts targets with drowsiness. 
Craftable item. 
The addition of fletching enables more precise shots that can travel farther.

Ammunition.Name: Golden Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Carved arrows made in tandem with the Erdtree Bow. Deals holy damage.   
 Highly effective against Those Who Live in Death, and able to prevent them from rising again.

Ammunition.Name: Explosive Greatbolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatbolt tipped with a clump of Explosive Stone shards. 
Detonates a large explosion on impact, dealing fire damage.

Ammunition.Name: Lordsworn's Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Well-crafted bolt with an illustrious design, wielded by regulars of a lord's army. 
 Deals more damage by its commonplace cousin.

Ammunition.Name: Golem's Great Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Greatarrow of black stone crafted by a civilization now gone to ruin. 
Used by the Guardian Golem. 
This hefty arrow is enrobed in tempestuous winds, allowing it to break enemy stances and guards with ease.

Ammunition.Name: Spiritflame Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow set alight with ghostflame before firing. Deals magic damage while also afflicting foes with frost. 
 Used by the Company of the Fallen Hawk, once ordered to explore the Eternal City.

Ammunition.Name: Coldbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone with a frozen tip. 
Afflicts targets with frost. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Magicbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a glintstone tincture. Deals magic damage. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Rainbow Stone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones tipped with chips of Rainbow Stone. 
Colored light shines at the point of impact. 
Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunition.Name: Shattershard Arrow
Ammunition.Lore: Arrows whittled from animal bones tipped with a shard of crystal. Creates a resonating noise at the point of impact.

Ammunition.Name: Bloodbone Arrow
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. 
Afflicts targets with blood loss.

Ammunition.Name: Rotbone Arrow (Fletched)
Ammunition.Lore:
Arrow whittled from animal bones. The tip is daubed with rot. Afflicts targets with scarlet rot. 
Craftable item. The fletching adds distance to the arrow's flight.

Ammunition.Name: Bloodbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with a blood tincture. Afflicts targets with blood loss. 
Craftable item.

Ammunition.Name: Poisonbone Bolt
Ammunition.Lore:
Bolt carved from animal bone. The tip is daubed with venom. Afflicts targets with poison. 
Craftable item.

Armor.Name: Fire Monk Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Black iron gauntlets featuring a flame motif. 
Attire of the Fire Monks. 
  
The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Armor.Name: Knight Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Iron greaves of an unknown knight. 
It is made of thin iron plate. 
Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Armor.Name: Blue Cloth Cowl
Armor.Lore:
Cowl of a nomadic warrior. 
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. 
 
Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. 
Warriors must remain ever-drifting.

Armor.Name: Queen's Bracelets
Armor.Lore:
Bracelets indicating the highest order of sorcerer. 
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. 
When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. 
 
And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Armor.Name: Cleanrot Helm
Armor.Lore:
Winged helm of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. 
 The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

Armor.Name: Champion Gaiters
Armor.Lore:
Gaiters formed only with leather straps. 
Common wear in the badlands.

Armor.Name: Prophet Blindfold
Armor.Lore:
Blindfold of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. 
Why hesitate, if the path leading to the future is clear? Just close your eyes, and walk.

Armor.Name: Mushroom Arms
Armor.Lore:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the arms.   
 To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Armor.Name: Haligtree Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. An iron helm graced by a crown of unalloyed gold. 
Increases faith.

Armor.Name: Knight Armor
Armor.Lore:
Iron armor of an unknown knight. 
It is made of thin iron plate. 
Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Armor.Name: Snow Witch Robe
Armor.Lore:
Witch's robe in the color of snow. 
 
Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. 
 
That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Armor.Name: Marionette Soldier Birdhelm
Armor.Lore:
Metal helm formed in the likeness of the face of a bird. 
Worn by avionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. 

The construction of this helm is remarkably crude. 
 For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Armor.Name: Omenkiller Boots
Armor.Lore: Long, stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.

Armor.Name: Sage Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Thick burgundy trousers. 
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. 
Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Armor.Name: Veteran's Helm
Armor.Lore:
An old helm that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the great veteran general of Sol. 
 Nial was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. 
 This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Armor.Name: Raging Wolf Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. 
According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

Armor.Name: Mushroom Head
Armor.Lore:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushroom have colonized the head.   
 To those enraptured by the scarlet rot, they are holy vestments that root one to the earth.

Armor.Name: Aristocrat Headband
Armor.Lore:
Valuable headband featuring fine goldwork. 
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. 
 Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are pitiful product of unending life.

Armor.Name: All-Knowing Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves set with countless eyes and ears. 
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. 
 
Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. 
 
At the end that should not be.

Armor.Name: Crucible Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. 
 
Hold the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthen Aspects of the Crucible incantations. 
 
In time, the strength shown by these knights, and even their appearance, was seen as chaotic and deserving of scorn.

Armor.Name: Vagabond Knight Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm of a knight banished from their motherland. 
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey.   
 The visor is broken and can no longer be lowered.   
 Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Armor.Name: Banished Knight Helm
Armor.Lore:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. 
This helm was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. 
 
Perhaps the deep-red scarf was used to block the winds, for on the outskirts, the winds bite with a stinging fierceness.

Armor.Name: Leyndell Soldier Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. 
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Armor.Name: Finger Maiden Shoes
Armor.Lore:
Shoes worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. 
 
The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. 
 
The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Armor.Name: Zamor Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. 
 
These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Armor.Name: Bloodhound Knight Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Metal greaves of the Bloodhound Knights.   
 The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.   
 Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made the knight stays loyal for life.

Armor.Name: Beast Champion Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Silver greaves engraved with tiny beasts. 
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. 
 Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. 

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Armor.Name: Perfumer Hood
Armor.Lore:
Hood of an Erdtree Capital perfumer. 
 In time past, the role of perfumer was much respected; a blessed apothecary in the eyes of the many. But after entering the battlefields of the Shattering they performed no such role, trading their aromatics for poisons and explosives.

Armor.Name: Octopus Head
Armor.Lore:
A land octopus whelp worn directly on the head. 
Has a lingering warmth reminiscent of human skin. 
 
Those who can withstand the smell will find its organic elasticity excellent for negating strikes.

Armor.Name: Twinsage Glintstone Crown
Armor.Lore:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. 
 
Greatly increases intelligence to the detriment of HP and stamina. 
 
Scholars of the Twinsage Conspectus were the elites of the academy, permitted to study and excel in sorceries of all kinds.

Armor.Name: Chain Coif
Armor.Lore:
Coif made of woven chain. Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. 
Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

Armor.Name: Elden Lord Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. 

The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. 

He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Armor.Name: Black Knife Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets used by the Black Knife Assassins. 
Crafted with scale armor that makes no sound. 
 
The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Armor.Name: Crucible Tree Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. 
 
The great tree ornamentation is the knight Siluria's mark, displayed also by her men. 
 
Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Armor.Name: Exile Gauntlets
Armor.Lore: Damaged iron gauntlets. Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Armor.Name: Prophet Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Trousers of the exiled prophets who foresaw that their faith would end in flames — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. 
Its fabric scrapes against their skin like a file, and the rickety cart wheel around the neck warns passers-by not to lend an ear to their meandering sermons.

Armor.Name: Twinned Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.   
 The two known as D are inseparable twins. 
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. 
 Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Armor.Name: Maliketh's Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Beast's greaves made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. 

Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. 
 
Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Armor.Name: Fur Leggings
Armor.Lore:
Leggings fashioned from bristly pelts. 
Worn by ancestral follower warriors. 
 The ancestral followers keep their distance from the Erdtree, awaiting new buds. They are certain to sprout from their very flesh, and indeed, their souls.

Armor.Name: Bandit Garb
Armor.Lore:
Leather garb worn by bandits. 
 Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In trade, they offer little damage negation.

Armor.Name: Land of Reeds Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor made from strips of iron fastened together. 
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. 

The grimy outer mantle is made from withered reeds from the warrior's birthplace. 
Perhaps its comforts extend to nostalgic thoughts of home. 
 Altered:
The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to the blood-soaked madness, or so it has said.

Armor.Name: Bandit Mask
Armor.Lore:
Mask of black cloth that covers the mouth. 
Favored by bandits for hiding their faces, it also provides some protection against poison.

Armor.Name: Traveling Maiden Boots
Armor.Lore:
Boots worn by traveling maidens. 
 Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Armor.Name: Foot Soldier Cap
Armor.Lore: Flanged iron cap widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Armor.Name: Zamor Bracelets
Armor.Lore:
Bracelets worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. 
 
These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Armor.Name: Eccentric's Armor
Armor.Lore:
Unusually colorful armor. Worn by the knight Jerren. 
 Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became a guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Armor.Name: Bull-Goat Helm
Armor.Lore:
Great Horned Tragoth's helm, adorned with a gold bull-goat motif. Provides high poise. 
 Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid

Armor.Name: Prisoner Clothing
Armor.Lore:
Tattered clothing. 
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. 
Never once washed, every fiber is filthy.

Armor.Name: Aristocrat Hat
Armor.Lore:
Leather hat decorated with a withered feather. 
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital, and the belonging of a family which claims a knight as an ancestor. 
 Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Armor.Name: Marais Mask
Armor.Lore:
Mask in the image of a white-haired young noble. 
Customarily worn by the head of House Marais. 
Increases arcane. 
 
The Marais family has a dual history spanning generations, serving as both executioners and castellans of the Shaded Castle. This mask bears the likeness of the first of their line.

Armor.Name: Bandit Manchettes
Armor.Lore:
Manchettes made by simple wrapping dirty cloth around the arms. 
Worn by bandits.

Armor.Name: Chain Leggings
Armor.Lore:
Leggings made of woven chain. 
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. 
Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

Armor.Name: Traveling Maiden Gloves
Armor.Lore:
Gloves worn by traveling maidens. 
 Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Armor.Name: White Reed Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inaba, head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.   
 The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothing more than to die by the sword.

Armor.Name: Eye Surcoat
Armor.Lore:
Brown surcoat draped over chainmail.   
 The insignia emblazoned on the front marks out the wearer as the eyes and ears of Sir Gideon the All-Knowing.

Armor.Name: Land of Reeds Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets wrapped in tough leather. 
Worn by the warriors of the Land of Reeds

Armor.Name: Godrick Knight Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. 
 Adorned with a plum of withered, ashen hair.

Armor.Name: Land of Reeds Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves wrapped in tough leather. 
Worn by the warriors of the Land of Reeds

Armor.Name: Olivinus Glintstone Crown
Armor.Lore:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. 
 
Increases intelligence to the detriment of HP. 
 
The lineage of the Olivinus Conspectus began with the sorcerer Lusat, and its adherents continue his study of meteors.

Armor.Name: Scaled Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm worn by Old Knight Istvan. 
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it highly effective against non-physical attacks. 
 Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survive to this day.

Armor.Name: Gelmir Knight Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves worn by knights once loyal to Praetor Rykard. 
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Armor.Name: Raging Wolf Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. 
According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. 
Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

Armor.Name: Warrior Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves of a nomadic warrior. 
Crafted from sturdy leather.

Armor.Name: Alberich's Bracers
Armor.Lore:
Mad Tongue Alberich's bracers. 
 Set with red glintstones said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. 
Strengthens thorn sorcery.   
 Alberiches was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Armor.Name: Aristocrat Garb
Armor.Lore:
High quality garb adorned with fine golden embroidery. 
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Terribly faded and tattered. 

Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Armor.Name: Omenkiller Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe worn by the Omenkillers, butchers of twisted conscience.   
 Its thick apron is worn in remembrance Rollo, the progenitor of the Omenkillers and a perfumer of antiquity.

Armor.Name: Blue Silver Mail Armor
Armor.Lore:
Chainmail armor crafted with blue silver. 
Worn by the wolf-riding Albinauric archers. 
 
Blue silver is a metal born from the same mother as the archers themselves, and provides protection from magic and frost.

Armor.Name: Godrick Knight Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. 
Time has yet to dull their luster.

Armor.Name: Sage Hood
Armor.Lore:
A burgundy pointed hood. 
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. 
Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Armor.Name: Foot Soldier Helmet
Armor.Lore:
Helmet with a protective metal plate. 
Widely issued to foot soldiers in lord's army.

Armor.Name: Preceptor's Long Gown
Armor.Lore:
A long, bright blue gown with the movements of the stars drawn upon it. 
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. 
 
Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Armor.Name: Rotten Duelist Helm
Armor.Lore:
Bronze helm decorated with innumerable snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. 
 
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

Armor.Name: Marionette Soldier Helm
Armor.Lore:
Cylindrical helm of plate metal reinforced with a lattice. Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. 
 The construction of this helm is remarkably crude. 
 For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Armor.Name: Veteran's Armor
Armor.Lore:
Old armor that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. 
 
Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. 
 
This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Armor.Name: Witch's Glintstone Crown
Armor.Lore:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. 
 
 Increases intelligence and arcane to the detriment of stamina. 
 This gentle-looking crown was granted to a scholar who excelled in her studies, which also merited the title of "witch. "

Armor.Name: Rotten Duelist Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves wrapped with bronze snakes, eaten through by scarlet rot. 
 
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

Armor.Name: Karolos Glintstone Crown
Armor.Lore:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. 
 
Increases intelligence to the detriment of stamina. 
 
The Karolos Conspectus is the oldest of the academy's lineages of study, begat by the sorcerer Azur. Scholars who follow in his footsteps pursue the mysteries of comets.

Armor.Name: Crimson Hood
Armor.Lore:
A hooded cloak of vivid crimson.  
Worn by expatriates royalty.  
Increases vigor.   
 Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on journeys without specific orders, to faraway lands from which they would never return. In other words, the gift of a cloak made it easier for undesirable to be on their way.   
 Roderika never once saw the guidance of grace.

Armor.Name: Hoslow's Armor
Armor.Lore:
Garish silver armor decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. 
 
When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. 
 
"I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion. "

Armor.Name: Knight Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Iron gauntlets of an unknown knight. It is made of thin iron plate. 
Such metal armor is heavy, but provides considerable damage negation.

Armor.Name: Prisoner Iron Mask
Armor.Lore:
Iron mask forced on a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. 
Thick, heavy, and utterly stifling. 
A foul creation designed to torment the wearer, either slowly fermenting hatred within their heart, or a spiritual fervor that is near indistinguishable from it.

Armor.Name: Bull-Goat Armor
Armor.Lore:
Great Horned Tragoth's armor. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.   
 Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Armor.Name: Deathbed Dress
Armor.Lore:
Extremely thin and sheer white dress worn by the Deathbed Companion as she embraces the dead. 
 
 Slowly replenishes the HP of nearby allies, but not that of the wearer. 
 
 The touch of the fabric is exceedingly soft, so as not to harm even the most withered corpse, while still sharing her warmth.

Armor.Name: All-Knowing Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm set with countless eyes and ears. Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. 
 
Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. 
 
At the end that should not be.

Armor.Name: Albinauric Mask
Armor.Lore:
Made from the largely unaltered hide of a young Albinauric. 
 Raises arcane, but reduces the HP recovery effects of the Flask of Crimson Tears. 
 A far cry from godskin, this Albinauric hide mask is the product of malicious mockery.

Armor.Name: Vagabond Knight Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets of a knight banished form their motherland. 
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. 

Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Armor.Name: Depraved Perfumer Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe worn by depraved perfumers. 
The embroidery on the apron is itself a curse upon the Erdtree. 

These heresy-inclined perfumers imbibe their own spices to alter body and mind. Their slow descent into self-destruction is what earned them their name.

Armor.Name: Sorcerer Leggings
Armor.Lore:
Leggings worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. 
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the legs.

Armor.Name: Scaled Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by Old Knight Istvan. 
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks. 
 Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.

Armor.Name: Twinned Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.   
 The two known as D are inseparable twins. 
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. 
 Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Armor.Name: Lord of Blood's Robe
Armor.Lore:
Attire of Mohg, Lord of Blood, embroidered with an extravagant gold emblem on black cloth. 
 
The dress of a Luminary, the reigning lord and hierarch of the coming dynasty of Mohgwyn. Or perhaps, of a raving lunatic.

Armor.Name: Blackflame Monk Armor
Armor.Lore:
Black iron armor adorned with ashen cloth. 
Attire of the Blackflame Monks. 
 The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Armor.Name: Snow Witch Skirt
Armor.Lore:
Witch's skirt in the color of snow. 

Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. 

That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Armor.Name: Imp Head (Elder)
Armor.Lore:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. 
 
Resembling an elder, it holds trace amounts of arcane knowledge.

Armor.Name: Maliketh's Armor
Armor.Lore:
Beast's armor made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. 
 
Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him. 
 
Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions.

Armor.Name: Prophet Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe of exiled prophets who foretold misfortune — and were persecuted and driven from their homes as a result. 

The shackles around the neck warn passersby not to lend an ear to their sermons. 
 
 Altered:
Made from rough fabric that scrapes against the slin like a sharpening file.

Armor.Name: Silver Tear Mask
Armor.Lore:
Mask fashioned from the corpse of a formless Silver Tear, supported by its hardened, shed husk. 
 
Greatly increases arcane to the detriment of physical attack power. 
 
To imitate the imitator is a cunning play indeed.

Armor.Name: Malformed Dragon Helm
Armor.Lore:
A malformed golden helm. Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels.   
 After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves

Armor.Name: Queen's Leggings
Armor.Lore:
Leggings indicating the highest order of sorcerer. 
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. 
 
When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. 
 
And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Armor.Name: Preceptor's Big Hat
Armor.Lore:
Large hat with the movements of the stars drawn on the inside of the brim. 
Worn by the magic preceptors who served the Carian royals. 
 Increases mind to the detriment of stamina. 
 Glintstone sorcerers are the descendants of astrologers, a fact that the Carians remain of aware of. Even if their fate has been long severed from the stars.

Armor.Name: Cleanrot Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. 
 The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

Armor.Name: Errant Sorcerer Boots
Armor.Lore: Commonplace leather boots, sturdy enough to withstand a long journey.

Armor.Name: Prisoner Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Tattered trousers. 
Worn by a prisoner convicted of an appalling crime. 
Never once washed, every fiber is filthy. 
The smell is beyond belief.

Armor.Name: Commoner's Headband
Armor.Lore:
A headband with the cloth removed. 
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. 
 
Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Armor.Name: Godrick Knight Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by knights loyal to Godrick The Grafted. 
 Its left breast is emblazoned with a two-headed war axe, an emblem of the golden lineage.  The knights surely boasted of their strength in days long gone.

Armor.Name: Raya Lucarian Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. 
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Armor.Name: Sorcerer Manchettes
Armor.Lore:
Manchettes worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. 
Made by wrapping a simple cloth around the forearms.

Armor.Name: Chain-Draped Tabard
Armor.Lore:
Padded cloth armor with a chainmail shawl draped over the shoulders. 
Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Armor.Name: Vagabond Knight Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves of a knight banished from their motherland. 
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. 
 Metal armor is heavy, but also sturdy, offering significant damage negation.

Armor.Name: Leyndell Knight Gauntlets
Armor.Lore: Gauntlets worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. Time has yet to dull their luster

Armor.Name: Preceptor's Gloves
Armor.Lore:
Gloves of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. 
Black and perfectly discreet.

Armor.Name: Cloth Trousers
Armor.Lore: Trousers made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Armor.Name: Radahn Soldier Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves worn by soldiers who fought by General Radahn's side. 
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Armor.Name: Navy Hood
Armor.Lore:
A hooded cloak of deep navy. 
 Worn by expatriated royalty. 
 Increases mind. 
 
Such cloaks were gifted to those who departed on missions to faraway lands, from which they would never return. But what choice did they have, having seen the guidance of grace?

Armor.Name: Scaled Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by Old Knight Istvan. 
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks. 
 Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.

Armor.Name: Raging Wolf Helm
Armor.Lore:
A helm worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. 
Vargram earned his nickname from the white wolf pelt that adorns this helm.

Armor.Name: Imp Head (Long-Tongued)
Armor.Lore:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. 
 Resembling a long-tongued demon, it holds trace amounts of vexatious dexterity.

Armor.Name: Preceptor's Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Trousers of the magic preceptors who serve the Carian royals. 
Black and perfectly discreet.

Armor.Name: Banished Knight Armor
Armor.Lore:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. 
This armor was worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. 
 
These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Armor.Name: Millicent's Robe
Armor.Lore: Robe worn by Millicent the Rotting

Armor.Name: Pumpkin Helm
Armor.Lore:
An oval helmet large enough to cover any head. 
Very heavy and very hard. 

Reduces damage from headshots and impacts. 
 
The inside of the helm is pitch black, keeping the crazed warrior within from panicking. 
Perhaps its rather roomy interior also helps alleviate feelings of pressure and claustrophobia.

Armor.Name: Sanguine Noble Waistcloth
Armor.Lore:
Waistcloth sewn from black cloth. 
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. 
 
Known to strike from pools of blood, these assassins are missionaries come to share the gospel of accursed blood.

Armor.Name: Iron Gauntlets
Armor.Lore: Ordinary iron gauntlets.

Armor.Name: Commoner's Shoes
Armor.Lore:
Modest shoes made of cloth. 
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. 
Only, there are no commoners remaining with their wits about them.

Armor.Name: Crucible Axe Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. 
 
Worn by the knight Ordovis and his men. 
 
Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Armor.Name: Beast Champion Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Silver gauntlets engraved with tiny beasts. 
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. 

Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. 

Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Armor.Name: Maliketh's Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Beast's gauntlets made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. 
 Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyral half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.   
 Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions

Armor.Name: Haligtree Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. 
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Armor.Name: Blue Cloth Vest
Armor.Lore:
Vest of a nomadic warrior. 
The blue color of its fabric symbolizes brisk waters, as fluid and flowing as the sword in the hand of its wearer. 
Just as still waters turn foul, stagnation leads to decay. 
Warriors must remain ever drifting.

Armor.Name: Alberich's Pointed Hat
Armor.Lore:
Mad Tongue Alberich's pointed hat, a sign of a heretical practitioner.   
 Set with red glintstones said to be formed by the blood of sacrifices. Strengthens thorn sorcery.   
 Alberiches was an aloof yet disturbed heretical sorcerer said to have been driven mad by jeering tongues during his service to the Roundtable Hold long ago.

Armor.Name: Eccentric's Breeches
Armor.Lore:
The knight Jerren's breeches. 
 Jerren preferred a nomadic existence, but after spending time as a guest of the Carian royals, he became the guest commander for General Radahn. And for the first time, the restless tumbleweed would be bound by honorable oath.

Armor.Name: Traveler's Slops
Armor.Lore:
Slops of a traveling perfumer of no renown.   
 An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen and all those seen as impure.

Armor.Name: Scaled Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by Old Knight Istvan. 
The corroded metal is reinforced with rock-hard scales, making it high effective against non-physical attacks. 

Istvan is one of a few wizened Tarnished who survived to this day.

Armor.Name: Maliketh's Helm
Armor.Lore:
Beast's helm made of black iron and decorated with gold. Worn by Maliketh the Black Blade. 
 Maliketh, Queen Marika's loyal half-brother, bore a blade imbued with Destined Death, and there was not one demigod who did not fear him.   
 Champions knew what was at stake. Indeed, that is what made them champions

Armor.Name: Beast Champion Helm
Armor.Lore:
Silver helm engraved with tiny beasts. Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. 
 The beasts, their eyes and ears covered, represent an oath: "See nothing, hear nothing, doubt nothing, and carry on, along the path set in stone. "

Armor.Name: Champion Bracers
Armor.Lore:
Bracers reserved for the bandlands' bravest.  
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes.  

Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Armor.Name: Exile Hood
Armor.Lore:
Deep red hood that covers the whole head. 

Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies, who were required to keep their faces hidden.

Armor.Name: Eccentric's Hood
Armor.Lore:
A pointy, ragged hood. 
Worn by the knight Jerren. 
 The hood hides an aged, bearded mask. 
 Jerren served General Radahn as a guest commander, and they are said to have sworn an oath of honorable death to one another.

Armor.Name: Hierodas Glintstone Crown
Armor.Lore:
One of the glintstone crowns bestowed upon Raya Lucaria scholars whose pursuits were deemed worthy. 
 
Increases intelligence and endurance to the detriment of FP. 
 
The crown of Hierodas was granted to scholars who engaged in nomadic study away from the academy.

Armor.Name: Page Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Trousers worn by pages who serve nobility and are mindful to keep them out of harm's way.   
 Traveling wear tailored with exquisite precision, to avoid any undue shame for the page's master.

Armor.Name: Champion Headband
Armor.Lore:
Headband reserved for the badlands' bravest. 
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. 
Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Armor.Name: Cleanrot Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. 
 The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

Armor.Name: White Reed Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.   
 The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. 
To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothingmore than to die by the sword.

Armor.Name: Marionette Soldier Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor of metal bands arranged in a lattice. 
Worn by marionette soldiers, crafted to serve the sorcerers. 
 The construction of this armor is remarkably crude, now rusted over and severely dented. 
 For a doll, the only thing that matters is that it does not break.

Armor.Name: Confessor Hood
Armor.Lore:
Black hood for blending in with the darkness. 
Worn by church confessors. 
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. 
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Armor.Name: Veteran's Greaves
Armor.Lore:
An old greaves that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the great veteran general of Sol. 
 Nial was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. 
 This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Armor.Name: Black Knife Armor
Armor.Lore:
Scale armor used by the Black Knife Assassins, forged to make no sound. 
 
Traces of power yet remain in its concealing veil, which muffles the sound of footsteps. 
 
The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Armor.Name: Upper-Class Robe
Armor.Lore:
Embroidered, bright green robe worn by noble children. 
Donning such a robe is traditionally the child's first show of burgeoning independence.

Armor.Name: Hoslow's Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Garish silver gauntlets decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. 
 When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. 
 "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion. "

Armor.Name: Highwayman Hood
Armor.Lore:
Hideously stained and ragged hood. 
Worn by former foot soldiers who have turned to banditry.

Armor.Name: Malformed Dragon Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Malformed golden greaves. 
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. 
 After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Armor.Name: Bloodsoaked Manchettes
Armor.Lore:
Manchettes formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. 
 
Any protection is welcome for the festering arms beneath.

Armor.Name: Radahn's Redmane Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm of the golden lion, with flowing red hair. 
Worn by General Radahn. 
 Radahn inheirted the furious, flaming red hair of his father Radagon, and is fond of its heroic impications. 

"I was born a champion's cub. Now I am the Lord of the Battlefield's lion. "

Armor.Name: Champion Pauldron
Armor.Lore:
Pauldron reserved for the badlands' bravest. 
Proof that the wearer has slaughtered countless foes. 
Following the example of their chieftain Hoarah Loux, the brave warriors of the badlands shun excess adornment.

Armor.Name: Zamor Legwraps
Armor.Lore:
Legwraps worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. 
 
These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Armor.Name: Astrologer Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe fashioned from supple cloth. 
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. 
They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. 
But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Armor.Name: Greathelm
Armor.Lore:
Sturdy greathelm made from iron. 
 
Though it is uncomfortably heavy and obstructs the vision of the wearer, it provides considerable damage negation.

Armor.Name: Blackflame Monk Greave
Armor.Lore:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. 
Attire of the Blackflame Monks. 
 The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Armor.Name: Bloodhound Knight Armor
Armor.Lore:
Metal armor with a jutting breastplate.  
Worn by the Bloodhound Knights.   
 The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.   
 Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Armor.Name: Exile Armor
Armor.Lore:
Damaged armor draped with a large deep-red cloth. 
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Armor.Name: Cleanrot Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor of the Cleanrot Knights, celebrated for their undefeated campaign in the Shattering. 
 The Cleanrot Knights vowed to fight alongside Malenia, despite the inevitable, if gradual, putrefaction of their flesh. Their acceptance of their fate made these battles fiercest of all.

Armor.Name: Leather Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Well-made leather trousers. 
The lower legs are each bound in cord for ease of movement.

Armor.Name: Imp Head (Cat)
Armor.Lore:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. 
Resembling a cat, it holds trace amounts of feline intelligence.

Armor.Name: Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by ordinary soldiers. 
 Though plain in appearance, they offer dependable protection.

Armor.Name: Radahn's Lion Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor depicting the golden lion. 
Worn by General Radahn. 
 The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Armor.Name: All-Knowing Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets set with countless eyes and ears. 
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. 
 
Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. 
 
At the end that should not be.

Armor.Name: Veteran's Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Old gauntlets that has seen many battles. Worn by Niall, the veteran general of Sol. 
 Niall was a lone survivor who commanded spirits to defend his long-passed master. 
 This aging general could not die, nor did he have anywhere to fade away.

Armor.Name: Noble's Trousers
Armor.Lore:
White trousers of superior craftsmanship. 
Worn by expatriated royalty. 
 
A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Armor.Name: Fia's Robe (Altered)
Armor.Lore: Worn by Fia, the Deathbed Companion, on her journey after being exiled from her home.

Armor.Name: Malformed Dragon Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Malformed golden gauntlets. 
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. 
 After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Armor.Name: Night Maiden Twin Crown
Armor.Lore:
Twin crowns worn by the nightmaidens of the Eternal City. 
Indicates the highest clerical rank, and hides the eyes with silk. 
 Long ago, the Nox invoked the ire of the Greater Will, and were banished deep underground. Now they live under a false night sky, in eternal anticipation of their liege. Of the coming age of the stars. And their Lord of Night.

Armor.Name: Fell Omen Cloak
Armor.Lore:
"A cloak of ragged fur worn about the exposed body of Margit, the Fell Omen. 
 Having slaughtered countless champions during the Shattering, the Fell Omen has become a horror to those who harbor ambitions for the Erdtree, or for Lordship. "

Armor.Name: Elden Lord Crown
Armor.Lore:
Crown of Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. 
 
The age of the Erdtree began amongst conflict, when Godfrey was lord of the battlefield. 
 
He led the War against the Giants. Faced the Storm Lord, alone. And then, there came a moment. When his last worthy enemy fell. And it was then, as the story is told, that the hue of Lord Godfrey's eyes faded.

Armor.Name: Chain Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor made of woven chain. 
Standard issue for ordinary soldiers. 
Though plain in appearance, it offers dependable protection.

Armor.Name: Bloodhound Knight Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Metal gauntlets of the Bloodhound Knights.   
 The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers.   
 Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made the knight stays loyal for life.

Armor.Name: Confessor Boots
Armor.Lore:
Leather boots of the church confessors. 
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. 
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Armor.Name: Sanguine Noble Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe of dyed black cloth featuring gold embroidery. 
Worn by the nobles who serve the Lord of Blood. 
 
The grand metallic pattern on the shoulder is a signifier of the noble rank they intend to claim upon the advent of the new dynasty they are working to install.

Armor.Name: Confessor Gloves
Armor.Lore:
Black leather gloves of the church confessors. 
The churches outside the Lands Between, dedicated to the teachings of the Two Fingers, send confessors out to follow the guidance of grace. 
The confessors are loyal servants to the Two Fingers, ready to hunt down and quietly dispose of their enemies.

Armor.Name: Carian Knight Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. 
The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen,  were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Armor.Name: Queen's Crescent Crown
Armor.Lore:
A tall crown depicting the moon. Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. Increases intelligence. 
 
When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. 
 
And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Armor.Name: Godrick Knight Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by knights loyal to Godrick the Grafted. 
 Time has yet to dull their luster.

Armor.Name: Omensmirk Mask
Armor.Lore:
Mask with long, hideously twisted horns worn by the Omenkillers. 
Increases strength. 
 
Bears the smirking face of an elder, twisted in wicked delight. 
 
This visage is carved in the image of the evil spirits that haunt the Omen in their nightmares.

Armor.Name: Lionel's Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Rounded iron greaves.  Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.   
 When this chivalrous, dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Armor.Name: Bloodhound Knight Helm
Armor.Lore:
Metal helm with a pointed beak. Worn by the Bloodhound Knights. 
The Bloodhound Knights are trained as hunters and known to be unshakable trackers. 
Without the use of language, each knight chooses his own master. Once the decision has been made, the knight stays loyal for life.

Armor.Name: Traveling Maiden Hood
Armor.Lore:
Hood worn by traveling maidens. 
 Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Armor.Name: Astrologer Gloves
Armor.Lore:
Gloves fashioned from fine, supple cloth. 
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. 
They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. 
But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Armor.Name: Land of Reeds Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm made from strips of iron fastened together. 
Worn by warriors of the Land of Reeds. 
The Land of Reeds has long been locked in a miserable civil war, during which time it has remained alienated from the cultures of its neighbors. Little wonder that the entire nation has succumbed to blood-soaked madness, or so it is said.

Armor.Name: Banished Knight Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Thick, full set of armor covering the entire body. 
These greaves were worn by knights who, whether by misfortune or misdeed, were forced to abandon their homes. 
These fierce warriors were each and all accomplished. Perhaps that is why, despite their territorial losses, they were still named knights.

Armor.Name: Kaiden Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Trousers worn by Kaiden sellswords. 

These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Armor.Name: All-Knowing Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor set with countless eyes and ears. 
Worn by Gideon Ofnir, the All-Knowing. 
 
Knowledge begins with the recognition of one's ignorance. The realization that the search for knowledge is unending. But when Gideon glimpsed into the will of Queen Marika, he shuddered in fear. 
 
At the end that should not be.

Armor.Name: Bull-Goat Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Great Horned Tragoth's greaves. Covers its wearer with a pair of giant horns, providing staunch poise.   
 Tragoth is a famed knight of assistance. Countless Tarnished, facing adversity in the Lands Between, have survived thanks only to the Great Horned One's aid.

Armor.Name: Old Aristocrat Gown
Armor.Lore:
Gown of soft cloth adorned with fine gold embroidery. 
Travel attire worn by nobles in the capital. Garb favored by the aged. 
 
Abandoning their birthplace after the Shattering, these undead wanderers are the pitiful product of unending life.

Armor.Name: Traveler's Hat
Armor.Lore:
Hat of a traveling perfumer of no renown.   
 An associate of a healer, he is said to be in search of new aromatics and flower gardens, in hopes of treating Misbegotten, Omen and all those seen as impure.

Armor.Name: Errant Sorcerer Manchettes
Armor.Lore:
Commonplace leather manchettes. 
Their hands are inlaid with dulled glintstone.

Armor.Name: Kaiden Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm worn by Kaiden sellswords. 
These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. 
Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Armor.Name: Ruler's Mask
Armor.Lore:
Mask in the image of a wizened sage. 
Customary dress among lords in a smaller nation. 
Increases faith. 
 
Such a mask illustrates the qualities of an ideal lord: chiefly, wise and possessing a certain defanged geniality. 
One at the center of society often finds these qualities most expedient.

Armor.Name: Cerulean Tear Scarab
Armor.Lore:
Blue scarab worn directly on the head. These scarabs roll clumps of cerulean tears during their labors. 
 Slightly increases the recovery effects of the Flask of Cerulean Tears, but increases damage taken.

Armor.Name: Imp Head (Corpse)
Armor.Lore:
Head covering made from the largely unaltered head of an impish golem. 
Resembling the visage of a corpse, it holds trace amounts of lingering faith.

Armor.Name: Foot Soldier Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Metal gauntlets covered in nicks and dents. 
Widely issued to foot soldiers in a lord's army.

Armor.Name: Exile Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Damaged iron greaves. 
Worn by soldiers sent to the penal colonies.

Armor.Name: Bandit Boots
Armor.Lore:
Leather boots worn by bandits. 
 Light for ease of movement, and supple for masking sound. In this trade, they offer little damage negation.

Armor.Name: Beast Champion Armor
Armor.Lore:
Silver armor engraved with tiny beasts. 
Worn by Bernahl the Recusant. 
 
Beasts are drawn to champions, and to lords. And this armor befits a champion worthy of becoming a lord. And that is what Bernahl was. 
 
Until his maiden threw herself into the fire.

Armor.Name: Hoslow's Helm
Armor.Lore:
A twin-tailed silver helm decorated with flowery adornments. Symbol of the head of the revered House of Hoslow. 
 Juno Hoslow had a younger brother who was all talk and no trousers.   
 His inability to commit to action was such that Juno inherited the Hoslow legacy without resistance, granting him the freedom to shower his little brother with adoration.

Armor.Name: Blackflame Monk Hood
Armor.Lore:
Mail hood of iron links covering a headband engraved with black flames. 
Attire of the Blackflame Monks. 
 The Blackflame Monks, enthralled by the god-slaying black flame, became traitors, abandoning their posts as guardians. The seduction of a taboo is never easily spurned.

Armor.Name: Briar Helm
Armor.Lore:
Battered iron helm from a foreign land. 
Worn by Elemer of the Briar. 
 The winding, rusted iron briars are the mark of the guilty, and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls. 

Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Armor.Name: Cloth Garb
Armor.Lore: Clothing made of coarse material, commonly worn in the Lands Between.

Armor.Name: Nox Mirrorhelm
Armor.Lore:
Helm fashioned from a crystal looking-glass. 
One among the Eternal City's ritual implements. 
Easily broken and weak against striking attacks. 
 
Worn by those committed to high treason, it wards off the intervention of the Greater Will and its vassal Fingers.

Armor.Name: Queen's Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe indicating the highest order of sorcerer. 
Worn by Rennala, Queen of the Full Moon. 
 
When Rennala, head of both the Academy of Raya Lucaria and the Carian royal family, lost her husband Radagon, her heart went along with him. 

And then, those at the academy realized. That Rennala was no champion, after all.

Armor.Name: Errant Sorcerer Robe
Armor.Lore:
Commonplace robe made of thick cloth. Worn by the Errant Sorcerer Wilhelm, one of the first Tarnished to visit Roundtable Hold. 
 
A silent seeker of sorcery, who had gone so far as to make contact with the primeval current, Wilhelm was led by guidance into confrontation with his friend Vargram, and it is said that he was then taken prisoner in Roundtable Hold.

Armor.Name: Hoslow's Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Garish silver greaves decorated with red embellishments. Passed down through the Hoslow family. 
 When Juno Hoslow received an invitation to the Volcano Manor, he discreetly refused. 
 "I have already walked many a road drenched in blood, yet never would I consider myself a champion. "

Armor.Name: White Reed Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets of the White Reeds, fashioned from banded iron plates. Worn by the Inabam head disciples of the great swordsman Okina.   
 The Inaba traveled in pursuit of not only the master who abandoned them, but also proper deaths, won honorably through hard-fought combat. To be a White Reed is to seek death; fitting for the Inaba, who desired nothingmore than to die by the sword.

Armor.Name: Juvenile Scholar Cap
Armor.Lore:
Cap worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. 
 
Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. 
 
Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

Armor.Name: Mushroom Crown
Armor.Lore:
Mushrooms found growing all over the body. These overgrown mushrooms form a towering headpiece. 
 
Raises attack power when something nearby suffers from poison or rot. 
 
Long ago, great lords served the scarlet rot. Perhaps such fungal bodies served as their crowns.

Armor.Name: Kaiden Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by Kaiden sellswords. 
  These hulking, fearless mercenaries, said to hail from the mountaintops of the wintry north, are adept at fighting on horseback. Kaiden is the name of their home settlement.

Armor.Name: Lionel's Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Founded iron gauntlets.  Worn by Lionel the Lionhearted.   
 When this chivalrous dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Armor.Name: Commoner's Simple Garb
Armor.Lore:
Garb with a modest cloth cape attached. 
Standard wear for commoners of the Lands Between. 
 
The board hung from the neck depicts a sprawling tree, its roots and branches forming two holes. This is a self-imposed shackle, a voluntary display of allegiance to the Erdtree that increases faith.

Armor.Name: Sage Robe
Armor.Lore:
Thick burgundy robe. 
Attire of the wise sages who were deemed heretical. 
Evidence that the wearer was driven from town.

Armor.Name: Juvenile Scholar Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe worn by young academy scholars, the juveniles birthed anew by the amber egg of Queen Rennala, the head of Raya Lucaria Academy. 
 
Yet their rebirth is not without imperfections, and thus do they repeat the process, eventually becoming utterly dependent upon it. 
 
Rebirth is as sleep to them, and with each awakening, memory fades into oblivion.

Armor.Name: Raya Lucarian Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. 
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Armor.Name: Zamor Mask
Armor.Lore:
Mask worn by knights of Zamor, hailed as heroes in the War against the Giants. 
These long-lived warriors, clad in biting, freezing winds, are said to have been the mortal enemies of the Fire Giants since time immemorial.

Armor.Name: Fire Monk Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Black iron greaves featuring a flame motif. 
Attire of the Fire Monks. 
 The Fire Monks are guardians of the flame of ruin, forbidden by the Erdtree and said to be kept high in the Mountaintops of the Giants.

Armor.Name: Lionel's Armor
Armor.Lore:
Round iron armor with a banner extending from its back.  Worn by the Lionel the Lionhearted.   
 When this chivalrous dauntless knight met Fia, who had been driven from her home, he declared himself to be her father.

Armor.Name: Shining Horned Headband
Armor.Lore:
Headband decorated by a pair of shining horns. Worn by ancestral follower shamans. 
 Horns with buds that also shine are ideal ceremonial items for ancestral worship. Strengthens Ancestral Infant's Head.

Armor.Name: Fire Monk Armor
Armor.Lore:
Black iron armor adorned with a red cloth. 
Attire of the Fire Monks. 
 
 The grotesque face sculpted on the chest is said to depict the corrupt ancient god of the flame. 
Taboos transform into lasting obsessions by virtue of the fear that they inspire.

Armor.Name: Raging Wolf Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by Vargram the Raging Wolf, one of the first Tarnished to visit the Roundtable Hold. 
According to the old legends, wolves are the shadows of the Empyrean. Vargram aspired to such a state himself.

Armor.Name: Vulgar Militia Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by lean, mean, and filthy militiamen. 
 Freshly-singed battlegrounds effusing with the stench of the dead. Forbidden lands that will be excised from the memory of history. This is where the vulgar militia serve, as untiring, unsung watchkeepers.

Armor.Name: Guardian Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Engraved golden greaves. 
Worn by the guardians of the Minor Erdtrees. 
 In accordance with an ancient pact with the Erdtree, it is said that their deaths led not to destruction, but instead to renewed, eternal life as guardians.

Armor.Name: Briar Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Battered iron gauntlets from a foreign land. 
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.   
 The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls. 

Elemer murderd numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Armor.Name: Crucible Tree Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. 

Worn by the knight Siluria and her men. 

Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Armor.Name: Haligtree Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. 
Rust-worn and stained through unending conflict.

Armor.Name: Astrologer Trousers
Armor.Lore:
Trousers worn inside a robe. 
Worn by those who look to the cosmos above. 
They read fate in the stars, and are said to be heirs of the glintstone sorcerers. 
But alas, the night sky no longer cradles fate.

Armor.Name: Briar Armor
Armor.Lore:
Battered iron armor from a foreign land. 
Worn by Elemer of the Briar.   
 The winding, rusted iron briars are a mark of the guilty and typically indicate a sentence of death. They also cause this armor to deal damage when performing dodge rolls. 

Elemer murdered numerous instructors and merchants, and was known as the Bell Bearing Hunter.

Armor.Name: Bloodsoaked Mask
Armor.Lore:
Mask formed from tightly-wound bandages soaked through with blood. 
 
Even the most ghastly cover is more inviting than the festering face beneath.

Armor.Name: Carian Knight Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. 
The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Armor.Name: Carian Knight Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. 

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were all decorated heroes, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Armor.Name: Rotten Gravekeeper Cloak
Armor.Lore:
Thick, bristly cloak eaten through by scarlet rot. 

The symbol of an underground gravekeeper's station.   
 Altered:
Worn by gladiators who were driven from the colosseum. 
The wearer becomes a slightly easier target for foes.

Armor.Name: Gelmir Knight Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by knights once royal to Praector Rykard. 
 It bears an emblem that none wear any longer, standing as it does for a lord that fell from loft ambition into gluttonous depravity. As the lord lost his dignity, so too did these knights lose their master.

Armor.Name: Vagabond Knight Armor
Armor.Lore:
Chest piece of a knight banished from their motherland.  
Dirty and battered after enduring a lengthy vagabond journey. 
 The crest emblazoned on the front is worn and dingy, no longer able to evoke sentiment. 
 Metal armor is heavy, but also study ordering significant damage negation.

Armor.Name: Black Knife Hood
Armor.Lore:
Hood used by the Black Knife Assassins. 
 
The assassins that carried out the deeds of the Night of the Black Knives were all women, and rumored to be Numen who had close ties with Marika herself.

Armor.Name: Haligtree Crest Surcoat
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by soldiers sworn to the Haligtree. 
The surcoat bears the crest of the Haligtree. Though watered with Miquella's own blood since it was a sapling, the Haligtree ultimately failed to grow into an Erdtree.

Armor.Name: Warrior Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets of a nomadic warrior. 
Crafted from sturdy leather.

Armor.Name: Twinned Armor
Armor.Lore:
Armor depicting entwined twins of gold and silver.   
 The two known as D are inseparable twins. 
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. 
 Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Armor.Name: Cuckoo Surcoat
Armor.Lore:
Armor worn by Raya Lucaria Academy soldiers. 
 
The surcoat depicts twinned cuckoos peering into a flourishing mass of glintstone. 

To a glintstone sorcerer, the body is a transient thing. The Cuckoo alone knows its insignificance, yet watches over it all the same.

Armor.Name: Millicent's Tunic
Armor.Lore: Tunic worn by Millicent the Rotting

Armor.Name: Malformed Dragon Armor
Armor.Lore:
Malformed golden armor. 
Adorned with various dragon imagery and worn by the misshapen Tree Sentinels. 
 
After the great ancient dragon Gransax attacked, the sentinels had an epiphany. The only way to truly protect the Erdtree was to become dragons themselves.

Armor.Name: Noble's Gloves
Armor.Lore:
Gloves of plush leather. 
Worn by expatriated royalty. 
 
A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Armor.Name: Iron Helmet
Armor.Lore:
An iron helmet showing rust on its edges. 
Cloth covering the mouth and neck provides some resistance to poison and other irritants.

Armor.Name: Radahn's Greaves
Armor.Lore:
Greaves depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.   
 The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Armor.Name: Omenkiller Long Gloves
Armor.Lore: Long, stiff leather gloves worn by the Omenkillers.

Armor.Name: Leyndell Knight Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm worn by knights sworn to defend the royal capital of Leyndell. 
 The golden canopy represents the honor of standing among the tree's defenders.

Armor.Name: Radahn's Gauntlets
Armor.Lore:
Gauntlets depicting the golden lion. Worn by General Radahn.   
 The golden lion is said to symbolize Godfrey, the first Elden Lord, and his beast regent, Serosh. From his youngest years, Radahn was naturally captivated by the Lord of the Battlefield.

Armor.Name: Twinned Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm depicting entwined twins of gold and silver. 
 The two known as D are inseparable twins. 
They are of two bodies and two minds, but one single soul. Not once do they stand together; not one word do they speak to one another. 
 Perhaps this armor longs to find its way to the other D.

Armor.Name: Noble's Traveling Garb
Armor.Lore:
Traveling attire fashioned from metallic white silk thread. Worn by expatriated royalty. 
 
A gift of such rare beauty, a royal wouldn't disgrace their illustrious heritage even if found dead, in a ditch, in the middle of nowhere, while wearing such splendid raiment.

Armor.Name: Raya Lucarian Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe worn by Raya Lucaria's magic scholars. 
Those who dedicate themselves to the study of glintstones formed from starry amber receive this modest yet elegant deep blue garb along with their vows of virtue and austerity. 
But with extended life, one is apt to forget old vows.

Armor.Name: Carian Knight Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm of the enchanted knights that once served the Carian royal family. 

The enchanted knights, anointed by the Lunar Queen, were heroes of the highest honors, but fell into disarray with the decline of the royal family.

Armor.Name: Finger Maiden Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe worn by maidens who serve the Two Fingers. 
 
The maidens live to serve a chosen Tarnished, sharing their guidance and the wisdom of the Two Fingers. 
 
The guidance of grace would ensure that the pair be brought together. Or at least, such was the promise long ago.

Armor.Name: Snow Witch Hat
Armor.Lore:
Witch's pointed hat, frigid and frozen through. Of a style associated with practitioners of heretical sorcery. Strengthens cold sorcery. 
 
Once worn by the snowy crone who the young Ranni encountered deep in the woods. She was a witch, and well versed in cold sorceries. It is said that the doll that houses Ranni's soul was modeled after her. 
 
That old witch was Ranni's secret mentor.

Armor.Name: Crucible Axe Helm
Armor.Lore:
Helm of the Crucible Knights who served Godfrey, the first Elden Lord. 
 
The axe ornamentation is the knight Ordovis's mark, displayed also by his men. 
 
Holds the power of the crucible of life, the primordial form of the Erdtree. Strengthens Aspects of the Crucible incantations.

Armor.Name: Traveling Maiden Robe
Armor.Lore:
Robe worn by traveling maidens. 
 
Maidens traversed the Lands Between for different reasons. Some to seek audience with the Fingers. Others, to find the Tarnished who they were destined to guide.

Armor.Name: Guilty Hood
Armor.Lore:
Coarse hooded cloak of olive brown.
